description.narrative: 1.1. By the end of 2021 government capacity on planning, service delivery and monitoring enhanced for quality and equitable health services (HSS & PHE/HiE).

sector.narrative: Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
HSS - Health sector policy, planning and governance at national or sub-national levels
HSS - Health systems procurement and supplies management
Maternal and newborn care policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

title.narrative: Zambia United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2017 Zambia: Mid-Term Evaluation of the Millennium Development Goal Initiative Accelerating Progress towards maternal neonatal and child mortality reduction in Zambia
2019 Zambia: Outcome evaluation of the investment in institutional community and individual capacity development
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.1. By the end of 2021 government capacity on planning, service delivery and monitoring enhanced for quality and equitable health services (HSS & PHE/HiE).

description.narrative: A coordinated response to the COVID-19 pandemic, health sector specific and multisectoral COVID-19 strategic plans were developed and in use. National public health guidelines on sustaining essential health services have been developed and disseminated. Essential medicines, vaccines and commodities have been procured and/or funds for their procurement leveraged to assure commodity security for sustaining delivery of essential health services. Catalytic funds for the community health system strategy have been secured and technical assistance provided for evidence-based analysis to inform the national Reproductive Maternal, Newborn, Child and Adolescent Health and Nutrition investment case. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Proportion of target districts with evidence based MTEF plans
Months with stockouts of all ACT at national level (Target: 0 months)
Proportion of Neighborhood Health Committees and other community structures oriented on NHC guidelines
Number of healthcare providers trained in detecting, referral and appropriate management of COVID-19 cases [COVIDSitRep]
Number of healthcare workers within health facilities and communities provided with Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) with UNICEF support [COVIDSitRep]
Number of healthcare facility staff and community health workers trained in Infection Prevention and Control (IPC) with UNICEF support [COVIDSitRep]
Child-sensitive national risk management plans addressing risks related to public health emergencies are in place
